profile.title: USDA Plants Database
profile.note: USDA plant profile pages are JavaScript-rendered. Full data extraction requires browser automation (Selenium/Playwright).

profile_page.note: Full HTML not stored in JSON. Use browser automation for complete data extraction.

plant_guide_pdf.note: PDF content stored separately. Use PDF parsing library to extract structured data.

extracted_data.description:
Custard-apple or Annona family
(Annonaceae). This perennial tree or shrub grows
from 3 to 12 m tall. The drooping, pear-shaped leaves
are alternate, from 10 to 30 cm long, with smooth
margins and pointed tips. The leaves are coated with
fine whitish hairs on the upper surface with rusty-
colored hairs on the under-side. Leaves are aromatic,
with a smell reminiscent of bell pepper.
Inconspicuous but interesting flowers (4 to 5cm in
diameter) with 3 sepals, are green upon opening and
© William S.

Description
General: Custard-apple or Annona family
(Annonaceae). This perennial tree or shrub grows
from 3 to 12 m tall. The drooping, pear-shaped leaves
are alternate, from 10 to 30 cm long, with smooth
margins and pointed tips. The leaves are coated with
fine whitish hairs on the upper surface with rusty-
colored hairs on the under-side. Leaves are aromatic,
with a smell reminiscent of bell pepper.
Inconspicuous but interesting flowers (4 to 5cm in
diameter) with 3 sepals, are green upon opening and
